title: Yasuo Q Damage Calculation
body: I've already read the notes from the wiki but I still don't understand. Can someone help?

replies.body:
> [{quoted}](name=PandoNation,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=6nPWORYN,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2015-12-07T20:44:28.866+0000)
>
> It's over 9000!  {{champion:157}}

http://thedaoofdragonball.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/01/vegeta-scouter-dbz-google-glass.jpg

Yes it's over 9 thousand.

INTENT: Yasuo's critical strike chance is doubled, but his critical strikes deal 90% damage (So a crit does 200% of your AD, but because his INTENT reduces it to 90% - his auto-attack crits will only do 180% Damage, instead of 200%. (Base crits are 2x Damage a.k.a 200% Damage) If he has an Infinity Edge with the +50% Crit Damage modifier (Or runes for that matter) again if he auto-attacks you and it crits it will deal 90% Damage - so 90% of that 250% of your AD which is 225% Damage.

INTENTS Crit reduction is reduced to 75% damage on Steel Tempest so his Crits will deal 25% less Damage (75%) when his Q applies them (His Q Can critically strike) so he will crit for 150% Damage when his Q applies the crit (instead of 200%) and if he has Infinity Edge, instead of it dealing 250% Damage it will be 75% (of that 250%) so he will critically strike (with Q) for 187.5% Damage.
it does more damage than aa early game. Less damage lategame. it has a 25% crit reduction while aa have 10% reduction.
